required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigational Testing of Bodycad Unicompartmental Knee Prosthesis (UKS)
clinical_study.official_title: Open-Label Investigational Testing of Bodycad Unicompartmental Knee Prosthesis (UKS) in Human Subjects With Medial Unicompartmental Knee Osteoarthritis

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to observe clinical outcomes of patient-specific knee arthroplasty in patients with osteoarthritis of the medial condyle.

detailed_description.textblock: The patient-specific Bodycad Unicompartmental Knee System will be implanted on patients with knee osteoarthritis of the medial condyle. The study's hypothesis is that personalized shape and fit of patient-specific knee replacement prosthesis will provide a greater stability and a more natural knee motion in addition to a faster recovery when compared to traditional knee replacement systems. This study is designed to provide a five-years follow-up clinical data on safety and effectiveness of the device.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Knee Society Score (KSS) Objective
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of improvement of clinical outcomes following BUKS implantation using the KSS questionnaire, to evaluate the clinical performance of the articulation

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Knee Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS)
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of improvement of activity levels following BUKS implantation surgery using the KOOS questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in mechanical axis measurement.
secondary_outcome.description: Determine by radiographic analysis Varus or Valgus, expected value are +/- 3 degrees

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of implant position fixation
secondary_outcome.description: The anteroposterior and medial lateral slop will be evaluated according to initial planed position. The measured angles will be compared with initial planning. The expected values are +/- 1.5 degree.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on bone loss and cementation
secondary_outcome.description: Those measurements will be done on x-ray of the patient joint following Knee Society Radiological evaluation form.The tibial component acceptable score for this device will be 2.5 mm. The femoral component acceptable score for this device will be 6 mm.

intervention.description: Unicompartmental Knee Arthroplasty Surgery using the Bodycad Unicompartmental Knee System (BUKS)
Unicompartmental Knee Arthroplasty Surgery using the Bodycad Unicompartmental Knee System (BUKS)

overall_official.affiliation: CHU de Quebec - Hopital de l'Enfant-Jésus
